intro: Icica panamensis, commonly known as the Panama icica, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
